Articles.Content:
BREXIT

For those of you who don't know what this is,
"Brexit is an abbreviation of "British exit" that mirrors the term Grexit. It refers to the possibility that Britain will withdraw from the European Union. The country will hold an in-out referendum on its EU membership on June 23." - http://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/brexit.asp

This is a highly political subject, so be mindful of that fact and keep the raw politics out of this. There are a lot of people (in both the financial and political world) who have yes and no opinions regarding the following question, and I'm wondering what You think might be - impact wise.

Do you think Brexit (if it happens) will have an impact on the ESA (European Space Agency) and it's current and future programs?
Apologies, but this is just a tad too deep into the realm of actual politics. I'm gonna have to lock this one up, sorry!
